    31→
    32→func handleSensorHistory(ctx context.Context, req mcp.CallToolRequest) (*mcp.CallToolResult, error) {
    33→	deviceID, err := req.RequireString("device_id")
    34→	if err != nil {
    35→		return mcp.NewToolResultError(err.Error()), nil
    36→	}
    37→
    38→	startDateStr, err := req.RequireString("start_date")
    39→	if err != nil {
    40→		return mcp.NewToolResultError(err.Error()), nil
    41→	}
    42→
    43→	endDateStr := req.GetString("end_date", "")
    44→	if endDateStr == "" {
    45→		endDateStr = time.Now().Format("2006-01-02")
    46→	}
    47→
    48→	limit := req.GetInt("limit", 200)
    49→
    50→	if limit < 1 || limit > 10000 {
    51→		return mcp.NewToolResultError("Limit must be between 1 and 10000"), nil
    52→	}
    53→
    54→	// Parse dates
    55→	startDate, err := time.Parse("2006-01-02", startDateStr)
    56→	if err != nil {
    57→		return mcp.NewToolResultError("start_date must be in YYYY-MM-DD format"), nil
    58→	}
    59→
    60→	endDate, err := time.Parse("2006-01-02", endDateStr)
    61→	if err != nil {
    62→		return mcp.NewToolResultError("end_date must be in YYYY-MM-DD format"), nil
    63→	}
    64→
    65→	if endDate.Before(startDate) {
    66→		return mcp.NewToolResultError("end_date must be after start_date"), nil
    67→	}
    68→
    69→	if dbAvailable() {
    70→		return sensorHistoryDB(ctx, deviceID, startDate, endDate, limit)
    71→	}
    72→	
    73→	// Fallback to API if database not available
    74→	return mcp.NewToolResultError("Database connection required for sensor_history tool. Please ensure DATABASE_URL is set to access real-time sensor data."), nil
    75→}
    76→
    77→func sensorHistoryDB(ctx context.Context, deviceID string, startDate, endDate time.Time, limit int) (*mcp.CallToolResult, error) {
    78→	// Check what tables are available in the database
    79→	tablesQuery := `
    80→		SELECT table_name 
    81→		FROM information_schema.tables 
    82→		WHERE table_schema = 'public'
    83→		ORDER BY table_name
    84→	`
    85→	
    86→	tableRows, err := queryRows(ctx, tablesQuery)
    87→	if err != nil {
    88→		return mcp.NewToolResultError("Could not query database schema: " + err.Error()), nil
    89→	}
    90→	
    91→	// Look for tables that might contain real-time sensor data
    92→	availableTables := make([]string, len(tableRows))
    93→	realtimeTable := ""
    94→	for i, row := range tableRows {
    95→		if tableName, ok := row["table_name"].(string); ok {
    96→			availableTables[i] = tableName
    97→			// Check for possible real-time sensor data tables
    98→			if tableName == "realtime_measurements" || 
    99→			   tableName == "measurements_realtime" || 
   100→			   tableName == "sensors" ||
   101→			   tableName == "devices" {
   102→				realtimeTable = tableName
   103→			}
   104→		}
   105→	}
   106→	
   107→	if realtimeTable == "" {
   108→		// If no real-time table found, return available tables for debugging
   109→		result := map[string]any{
   110→			"message": "No known real-time sensor data tables found in database.",
   111→			"available_tables": availableTables,
   112→			"suggestion": "Real-time sensor data may not be available through this database connection.",
   113→		}
   114→		return jsonResult(result)
   115→	}
   116→	
   117→	// Query the appropriate real-time table for time-series data
   118→	query := fmt.Sprintf(`
   119→		SELECT 
   120→			id,
   121→			device_id,
   122→			COALESCE(device_name, device_id) AS device_name,
   123→			value,
   124→			COALESCE(unit, 'µSv/h') AS unit,
   125→			to_timestamp(measured_at) AS captured_at,
   126→			lat AS latitude,
   127→			lon AS longitude,
   128→			COALESCE(transport, '') AS transport
   129→		FROM %s
   130→		WHERE device_id = $1 
   131→			AND measured_at >= $2 
   132→			AND measured_at <= $3
   133→		ORDER BY measured_at ASC
   134→		LIMIT $4`, realtimeTable)
   135→
   136→	startUnix := startDate.Unix()
   137→	endUnix := endDate.Unix()
   138→
   139→	rows, err := queryRows(ctx, query, deviceID, startUnix, endUnix, limit)
   140→	if err != nil {
   141→		return mcp.NewToolResultError(fmt.Sprintf("Error querying %s table: %v", realtimeTable, err)), nil
   142→	}
   143→
   144→	measurements := make([]map[string]any, len(rows))
   145→	for i, r := range rows {
   146→		measurements[i] = map[string]any{
   147→			"id":          r["id"],
   148→			"device_id":   r["device_id"],
   149→			"device_name": r["device_name"],
   150→			"value":       r["value"],
   151→			"unit":        r["unit"],
   152→			"captured_at": r["captured_at"],
   153→			"location": map[string]any{
   154→				"latitude":  r["latitude"],
   155→				"longitude": r["longitude"],
   156→			},
   157→			"type":   r["transport"],
   158→		}
   159→	}
   160→
   161→	capturedAfter := startDate.Format("2006-01-02") + " 00:00"
   162→	capturedBefore := endDate.Format("2006-01-02") + " 23:59"
   163→
   164→	result := map[string]any{
   165→		"device": map[string]any{
   166→			"id": deviceID,
   167→		},
   168→		"period": map[string]any{
   169→			"start_date": capturedAfter,
   170→			"end_date":   capturedBefore,
   171→		},
   172→		"count":        len(measurements),
   173→		"source":       "database",
   174→		"measurements": measurements,
   175→		"table_used": realtimeTable,
   176→		"available_tables": availableTables,
   177→		"_ai_generated_note": "This data was retrieved by an AI assistant using Safecast tools. The interpretation and presentation of this data may be influenced by the AI system.",
   178→	}
   179→
   180→	return jsonResult(result)
   181→}

    29→func handleDeviceHistory(ctx context.Context, req mcp.CallToolRequest) (*mcp.CallToolResult, error) {
    30→	deviceIDStr, err := req.RequireString("device_id")
    31→	if err != nil {
    32→		return mcp.NewToolResultError(err.Error()), nil
    33→	}
    34→
    35→	days := req.GetInt("days", 30)
    36→	limit := req.GetInt("limit", 200)
    37→
    38→	if days < 1 || days > 365 {
    39→		return mcp.NewToolResultError("days must be between 1 and 365"), nil
    40→	}
    41→	if limit < 1 || limit > 10000 {
    42→		return mcp.NewToolResultError("Limit must be between 1 and 10000"), nil
    43→	}
    44→
    45→	if dbAvailable() {
    46→		return deviceHistoryDB(ctx, deviceIDStr, days, limit)
    47→	}
    48→	return deviceHistoryAPI(ctx, deviceIDStr, days, limit)
    49→}

    51→func deviceHistoryDB(ctx context.Context, deviceID string, days, limit int) (*mcp.CallToolResult, error) {
    52→	now := time.Now().UTC()
    53→	startDate := now.AddDate(0, 0, -days)
    54→
    55→	// Query both markers table and realtime_measurements table
    56→	// First, try markers table (bGeigie imports)
    57→	markersQuery := `
    58→		SELECT id, doserate AS value, 'µSv/h' AS unit,
    59→			to_timestamp(date) AS captured_at,
    60→			lat AS latitude, lon AS longitude,
    61→			altitude AS height, detector, trackid::text AS track_id
    62→		FROM markers
    63→		WHERE device_id = $1 AND date >= $2 AND date <= $3
    64→		ORDER BY date DESC
    65→		LIMIT $4`
    66→
    67→	markersRows, err := queryRows(ctx, markersQuery, deviceID, startDate.Unix(), now.Unix(), limit)
    68→	if err != nil {
    69→		return mcp.NewToolResultError(err.Error()), nil
    70→	}
    71→
    72→	// Then, query realtime_measurements table (fixed sensors)
    73→	// First, check if the table exists and what columns it has
    74→	columnsQuery := `
    75→		SELECT column_name
    76→		FROM information_schema.columns
    77→		WHERE table_name = 'realtime_measurements'
    78→		ORDER BY column_name
    79→	`
    80→	
    81→	var realtimeRows []map[string]any
    82→	
    83→	columnRows, err := queryRows(ctx, columnsQuery)
    84→	if err != nil || len(columnRows) == 0 {
    85→		// If we can't query the schema or table doesn't exist, try the basic query
    86→		realtimeQuery := `
    87→			SELECT id, value, unit,
    88→				to_timestamp(measured_at) AS captured_at,
    89→				lat AS latitude, lon AS longitude,
    90→				device_name, transport, device_id
    91→			FROM realtime_measurements
    92→			WHERE device_id = $1 AND measured_at >= $2 AND measured_at <= $3
    93→			ORDER BY measured_at DESC
    94→			LIMIT $4`
    95→
    96→		realtimeRows, err = queryRows(ctx, realtimeQuery, deviceID, startDate.Unix(), now.Unix(), limit)
    97→		if err != nil {
    98→			return mcp.NewToolResultError("Error querying realtime_measurements table: " + err.Error()), nil
    99→		}
   100→	} else {
   101→		// Build the query based on available columns
   102→		hasHeight := false
   103→		for _, row := range columnRows {
   104→			if colName, ok := row["column_name"].(string); ok && colName == "height" {
   105→				hasHeight = true
   106→				break
   107→			}
   108→		}
   109→		
   110→		var realtimeQuery string
   111→		if hasHeight {
   112→			realtimeQuery = `
   113→				SELECT id, value, unit,
   114→					to_timestamp(measured_at) AS captured_at,
   115→					lat AS latitude, lon AS longitude,
   116→					device_name, transport, device_id, height
   117→				FROM realtime_measurements
   118→				WHERE device_id = $1 AND measured_at >= $2 AND measured_at <= $3
   119→				ORDER BY measured_at DESC
   120→				LIMIT $4`
   121→		} else {
   122→			realtimeQuery = `
   123→				SELECT id, value, unit,
   124→					to_timestamp(measured_at) AS captured_at,
   125→					lat AS latitude, lon AS longitude,
   126→					device_name, transport, device_id
   127→				FROM realtime_measurements
   128→				WHERE device_id = $1 AND measured_at >= $2 AND measured_at <= $3
   129→				ORDER BY measured_at DESC
   130→				LIMIT $4`
   131→		}
   132→
   133→		realtimeRows, err = queryRows(ctx, realtimeQuery, deviceID, startDate.Unix(), now.Unix(), limit)
   134→		if err != nil {
   135→			return mcp.NewToolResultError("Error querying realtime_measurements table: " + err.Error()), nil
   136→		}
   137→	}
   138→
   139→	// Combine results and sort by timestamp (most recent first)
   140→	allMeasurements := make([]map[string]any, 0, len(markersRows)+len(realtimeRows))
   141→	
   142→	// Process markers results
   143→	for _, r := range markersRows {
   144→		measurement := map[string]any{
   145→			"id":    r["id"],
   146→			"value": r["value"],
   147→			"unit":  r["unit"],
   148→			"captured_at": r["captured_at"],
   149→			"location": map[string]any{
   150→				"latitude":  r["latitude"],
   151→				"longitude": r["longitude"],
   152→			},
   153→			"height":   r["height"],
   154→			"detector": r["detector"],
   155→			"source":   "bgeigie_import",
   156→		}
   157→		if r["track_id"] != nil {
   158→			measurement["track_id"] = r["track_id"]
   159→		}
   160→		allMeasurements = append(allMeasurements, measurement)
   161→	}
   162→	
   163→	// Process realtime results
   164→	for _, r := range realtimeRows {
   165→		measurement := map[string]any{
   166→			"id":    r["id"],
   167→			"value": r["value"],
   168→			"unit":  r["unit"],
   169→			"captured_at": r["captured_at"],
   170→			"location": map[string]any{
   171→				"latitude":  r["latitude"],
   172→				"longitude": r["longitude"],
   173→			},
   174→			"height":   r["height"],
   175→			"device_name": r["device_name"],
   176→			"type":     r["transport"],
   177→			"source":   "realtime_sensor",
   178→		}
   179→		allMeasurements = append(allMeasurements, measurement)
   180→	}
   181→
   182→	// Sort all measurements by captured_at timestamp (most recent first)
   183→	// Since queryRows returns timestamps as interface{}, we need to handle both string and time.Time types
   184→	for i := 0; i < len(allMeasurements)-1; i++ {
   185→		for j := 0; j < len(allMeasurements)-i-1; j++ {
   186→			// Get the timestamp values - they could be strings or time.Time objects
   187→			time1Val := allMeasurements[j]["captured_at"]
   188→			time2Val := allMeasurements[j+1]["captured_at"]
   189→			
   190→			// Compare timestamps - swap if j-th element is older than (j+1)-th element
   191→			shouldSwap := false
   192→			
   193→			// Handle different possible types for timestamps
   194→			switch v1 := time1Val.(type) {
   195→			case string:
   196→				if v2, ok := time2Val.(string); ok {
   197→					if v1 < v2 {
   198→						shouldSwap = true
   199→					}
   200→				}
   201→			case time.Time:
   202→				if v2, ok := time2Val.(time.Time); ok {
   203→					if v1.Before(v2) {
   204→						shouldSwap = true
   205→					}
   206→				}
   207→			}
   208→			
   209→			if shouldSwap {
   210→				allMeasurements[j], allMeasurements[j+1] = allMeasurements[j+1], allMeasurements[j]
   211→			}
   212→		}
   213→	}
   214→
   215→	// Apply limit
   216→	measurements := allMeasurements
   217→	if len(measurements) > limit {
   218→		measurements = measurements[:limit]
   219→	}
   220→
   221→	capturedAfter := startDate.Format("2006-01-02") + " 00:00"
   222→	capturedBefore := now.Format("2006-01-02") + " 23:59"
   223→
   224→	result := map[string]any{
   225→		"device": map[string]any{
   226→			"id": deviceID,
   227→		},
   228→		"period": map[string]any{
   229→			"days":       days,
   230→			"start_date": capturedAfter,
   231→			"end_date":   capturedBefore,
   232→		},
   233→		"count":        len(measurements),
   234→		"source":       "database",
   235→		"measurements": measurements,
   236→		"_ai_generated_note": "This data was retrieved by an AI assistant using Safecast tools. The interpretation and presentation of this data may be influenced by the AI system.",
   237→	}
   238→
   239→	return jsonResult(result)
   240→}
   241→
   242→func deviceHistoryAPI(ctx context.Context, deviceIDStr string, days, limit int) (*mcp.CallToolResult, error) {
   243→	resp, err := client.GetRealtimeHistory(ctx, deviceIDStr)
   244→	if err != nil {
   245→		return mcp.NewToolResultError(err.Error()), nil
   246→	}
   247→
   248→	now := time.Now().UTC()
   249→	startDate := now.AddDate(0, 0, -days)
   250→	capturedAfter := startDate.Format("2006-01-02") + " 00:00"
   251→	capturedBefore := now.Format("2006-01-02") + " 23:59"
   252→	startUnix := startDate.Unix()
   253→
   254→	// Extract dose rate time series and filter by date range
   255→	var measurements []map[string]any
   256→	if series, ok := resp["series"].(map[string]any); ok {
   257→		if doseRate, ok := series["doseRate"].([]any); ok {
   258→			for _, raw := range doseRate {
   259→				pt, ok := raw.(map[string]any)
   260→				if !ok {
   261→					continue
   262→				}
   263→				ts, ok := toFloat(pt["time"])
   264→				if !ok || int64(ts) < startUnix {
   265→					continue
   266→				}
   267→				t := time.Unix(int64(ts), 0).UTC()
   268→				measurements = append(measurements, map[string]any{
   269→					"value":       pt["value"],
   270→					"unit":        "µSv/h",
   271→					"captured_at": t.Format(time.RFC3339),
   272→				})
   273→			}
   274→		}
   275→	}
   276→
   277→	totalAvailable := len(measurements)
   278→	if limit > len(measurements) {
   279→		limit = len(measurements)
   280→	}
   281→	measurements = measurements[:limit]
   282→
   283→	deviceInfo := map[string]any{
   284→		"id": deviceIDStr,
   285→	}
   286→	if name, ok := resp["deviceName"].(string); ok && name != "" {
   287→		deviceInfo["name"] = name
   288→	}
   289→	if tube, ok := resp["tube"].(string); ok && tube != "" {
   290→		deviceInfo["sensor"] = tube
   291→	}
   292→
   293→	result := map[string]any{
   294→		"device": deviceInfo,
   295→		"period": map[string]any{
   296→			"days":       days,
   297→			"start_date": capturedAfter,
   298→			"end_date":   capturedBefore,
   299→		},
   300→		"count":           len(measurements),
   301→		"total_available": totalAvailable,
   302→		"source":          "api",
   303→		"measurements":    measurements,
   304→		"_ai_generated_note": "This data was retrieved by an AI assistant using Safecast tools. The interpretation and presentation of this data may be influenced by the AI system.",
   305→	}
   306→
   307→	if ranges, ok := resp["ranges"].(map[string]any); ok {
   308→		if dr, ok := ranges["doseRate"].(map[string]any); ok {
   309→			result["statistics"] = map[string]any{
   310→				"min_usvh": dr["min"],
   311→				"max_usvh": dr["max"],
   312→				"avg_usvh": dr["avg"],
   313→			}
   314→		}
   315→	}
   316→
   317→	return jsonResult(result)
   318→}
   319→

name: Build and Deploy

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
    paths:
      - 'go/cmd/**'
      - 'go/go.mod'
      - 'go/go.sum'
      - '.github/workflows/deploy.yml'
  workflow_dispatch:

jobs:
  deploy:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Set up Go
        uses: actions/setup-go@v5
        with:
          go-version-file: go/go.mod
          cache-dependency-path: go/go.sum

      - name: Build
        working-directory: go
        run: GOOS=linux GOARCH=amd64 go build -o ../safecast-mcp ./cmd/mcp-server/

      - name: Deploy to VPS
        env:
          SSH_PRIVATE_KEY: ${{ secrets.SSH_PRIVATE_KEY }}
          VPS_HOST: ${{ secrets.VPS_HOST }}
          DATABASE_URL: ${{ secrets.DATABASE_URL }}
        run: |
          # Set up SSH
          mkdir -p ~/.ssh
          echo "$SSH_PRIVATE_KEY" > ~/.ssh/deploy_key
          chmod 600 ~/.ssh/deploy_key
          ssh-keyscan -H "$VPS_HOST" >> ~/.ssh/known_hosts 2>/dev/null

          SSH="ssh -i ~/.ssh/deploy_key -o ServerAliveInterval=10 root@$VPS_HOST"

          # Upload new binary (rsync uses delta transfer for faster uploads)
          rsync -avz -e "ssh -i ~/.ssh/deploy_key" safecast-mcp "root@$VPS_HOST:/root/safecast-mcp-server/safecast-mcp-new"

          # Write env file to server (avoids quoting issues with special chars in URLs)
          ENV_FILE="MCP_BASE_URL=https://$VPS_HOST/mcp"
          if [ -n "$DATABASE_URL" ]; then
            ENV_FILE="$ENV_FILE
          DATABASE_URL=$DATABASE_URL"
          fi
          echo "$ENV_FILE" | $SSH "cat > /root/safecast-mcp-server/.env"

          # Replace binary and restart via systemd
          $SSH "cd /root/safecast-mcp-server && \
            rm -f safecast-mcp && \
            mv safecast-mcp-new safecast-mcp && \
            chmod +x safecast-mcp && \
            systemctl restart safecast-mcp"

          # Wait for server to start
          sleep 3

      - name: Health check
        env:
          VPS_HOST: ${{ secrets.VPS_HOST }}
        run: |
          RESPONSE=$(curl -s -o /dev/null -w "%{http_code}" \
            -X POST \
            -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
            -d '{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":1,"method":"initialize","params":{"protocolVersion":"2025-03-26","capabilities":{},"clientInfo":{"name":"ci","version":"1.0"}}}' \
            "https://$VPS_HOST/mcp-http" \
            --max-time 10)
          if [ "$RESPONSE" = "200" ]; then
            echo "Health check passed (HTTP 200)"
          else
            echo "Health check failed (HTTP $RESPONSE)"
            exit 1
          fi

content.thinking:
The workflow has a `sleep 3` on line 64, which waits 3 seconds for the server to start before running the health check. But apparently 3 seconds isn't enough.

The health check is getting HTTP 503, which typically means:1. The server is starting up but not ready yet (too quick)
2. The server crashed and systemd is trying to restart it
3. There's an error in the code preventing startup

Let me increase the sleep time to give the server more time to start up. I'll change it from 3 seconds to 10 seconds.

          sleep 10

- name: Health check
        env:
          VPS_HOST: ${{ secrets.VPS_HOST }}
        run: |
          MAX_ATTEMPTS=5
          ATTEMPT=1
          while [ $ATTEMPT -le $MAX_ATTEMPTS ]; do
            echo "Health check attempt $ATTEMPT of $MAX_ATTEMPTS..."
            RESPONSE=$(curl -s -o /dev/null -w "%{http_code}" \
              -X POST \
              -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
              -d '{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":1,"method":"initialize","params":{"protocolVersion":"2025-03-26","capabilities":{},"clientInfo":{"name":"ci","version":"1.0"}}}' \
              "https://$VPS_HOST/mcp-http" \
              --max-time 10)
            if [ "$RESPONSE" = "200" ]; then
              echo "Health check passed (HTTP 200)"
              exit 0
            fi
            echo "Health check failed (HTTP $RESPONSE)"
            if [ $ATTEMPT -lt $MAX_ATTEMPTS ]; then
              echo "Waiting 5 seconds before retry..."
              sleep 5
            fi
            ATTEMPT=$((ATTEMPT + 1))
          done
          echo "Health check failed after $MAX_ATTEMPTS attempts"
          exit 1

var args []interface{}

	if deviceID != "" {
		// Get latest reading from specific device
		query = fmt.Sprintf(`
			SELECT 
				id,
				device_id,
				COALESCE(device_name, device_id) AS device_name,
				value,
				COALESCE(unit, 'µSv/h') AS unit,
				to_timestamp(measured_at) AS captured_at,
				lat AS latitude,
				lon AS longitude,
				COALESCE(transport, '') AS transport
			FROM %s
			WHERE device_id = $1
			ORDER BY measured_at DESC
			LIMIT 1`, realtimeTable)
		
		args = []interface{}{deviceID}
	} else {
		// Get latest readings from all sensors in geographic area
		query = fmt.Sprintf(`
			SELECT 
				rm.id,
				rm.device_id,
				COALESCE(rm.device_name, rm.device_id) AS device_name,
				rm.value,
				COALESCE(rm.unit, 'µSv/h') AS unit,
				to_timestamp(rm.measured_at) AS captured_at,
				rm.lat AS latitude,
				rm.lon AS longitude,
				COALESCE(rm.transport, '') AS transport
			FROM %s rm
			INNER JOIN (
				SELECT device_id, MAX(measured_at) as max_measured_at
				FROM %s
				WHERE lat >= $1 AND lat <= $2 AND lon >= $3 AND lon <= $4
				GROUP BY device_id
			) latest ON rm.device_id = latest.device_id AND rm.measured_at = latest.max_measured_at
			WHERE rm.lat >= $1 AND rm.lat <= $2 AND rm.lon >= $3 AND rm.lon <= $4
			ORDER BY rm.measured_at DESC
			LIMIT $5`, realtimeTable, realtimeTable)
		
		args = []interface{}{minLat, maxLat, minLon, maxLon, limit}
	}

	rows, err := queryRows(ctx, query, args...)
	if err != nil {
		return mcp.NewToolResultError(fmt.Sprintf("Error querying %s table: %v", realtimeTable, err)), nil
	}

	readings := make([]map[string]any, len(rows))
	for i, r := range rows {
		readings[i] = map[string]any{
			"id":          r["id"],
			"device_id":   r["device_id"],
			"device_name": r["device_name"],
			"value":       r["value"],
			"unit":        r["unit"],
			"captured_at": r["captured_at"],
			"location": map[string]any{
				"latitude":  r["latitude"],
				"longitude": r["longitude"],
			},
			"type": r["transport"],
		}
	}

	result := map[string]any{
		"count":    len(readings),
		"source":   "database",
		"readings": readings,
		"table_used": realtimeTable,
		"available_tables": availableTables,
		"_ai_generated_note": "This data was retrieved by an AI assistant using Safecast tools. The interpretation and presentation of this data may be influenced by the AI system.",
	}

	return jsonResult(result)
